reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I never did get a refund through Budget-host when I was charged $160 for two nights when the man working the hotel desk charged me twice the amount I paid through Orbitz. It was supposed to be $40 per night. The only plus was we brought our dog, and were able to leave him in the room while we were out. The first time we stayed here in July of 2007, it wasn't too bad. The rooms were clean and there were not shady figures staying in the surrounding rooms. I do not know if they are under new management, but I would advise anyone to stay away from here.
reviews.title: Dirty Rooms & Double-Charged

reviews.text: This hotel is on the "Mother Road" or Route 66. It is orginal in many respects from that time period. Everything is old, and the motel isn't much. It is well located in Flagstaff because it is along Route 66 but that is it.
reviews.title: DO NOT STAY HERE

reviews.text: Motel room - stinky, bed linen - dirty, air conditioner - noisy, towel - ever lesser like guest,
reviews.title: hungaryans

reviews.text: crew - stinker, impostor, to smatter in english, bumptious, squirt. Never again not in Budget Host Saga Motel!
reviews.title: Do not even think about staying here....

reviews.text: The room had a funny smell! The ac barely worked. The pool has an inch of green water. And the wireless internet didn't work. We left almost the moment we got there and didn't turn back. The guy running the place is rude and unhelpful. Do not stay here... it is the bates motel!!!
reviews.title: Turn around and run, sleeping in a roadside ditch is better.

likes.liked: — It was on themain road through town making it easier to find another place.
likes.disliked: — Nothing. The people who run it have no scruples.

reviews.text: horrible severice,dirty room and worest food. nightmare
reviews.title: horrible severice,dirty room and worest food. nightmare
One of the worst experiences ever
reviews.text: I booked 2 rooms through a discount site for myself and my family. Huge mistake that leaves me wondering if I should ever use the service again. The rate was decent; not great and less than $5 from what is advertised as full rates. Upon arrival we were told we had rooms with only one bed each when we needed two. We were forced to pay and additional $15 for a room with a second bed. The toilet in one of the rooms sprayed water all over the floor and shower when flushed and the wall paper in one of the bathrooms was peeling off. Another major problem with one room was that the front door didn't close and lock easily making me feel insecrure in my room. Management was helpful in resolving the problems I encountered. I would never go back here or recommend this motel to anyone.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Budget Saga Motel, as a last minute escape from the Phoenix heat, this past Labor Day Weekend.
reviews.title: Oh, what a saga we had...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can say few positive things about the room... It was more spacious then the Motel 6 that we stayed at earlier. We had a king size bed, a working bathroom and sink and free wifi. We were initially pleased with the room; however, this is where all warm fuzzy feelings end.
reviews.title: Rooms to the Highest Bidder (Crooks!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After an afternoon of experiencing the charm of Flagstaff, we return to the room to realize that the flimsy locks on the door do not provide much security. This is the beginning of my dwindling sense of security.
reviews.title: horrible service

reviews.text: I had stayed at the Saga previously about seven years ago. We had a room at the back of the complex and it was somewhat modern and clean. It was just what we needed before our Grand Canyon visit. We were very satisfied with our room... Fast forward seven years and I discovered that the Saga has new owners/management. They gave us a room at the front of the complex near a busy street - the wonderful sounds of traffic! The room seemed fine at first, but there was a draft. Ah, there looked to be a one inch gap between the bottom of the front door and the door sill. Good thing it wasn't winter! I then took a walk to the bathroom - Yikes! It looked as if the bathroom had been remodeled about 50 years ago. It was grungy and ready to fall apart - tile falling off the shower area, stained sink, rusty fixtures, etc - I was afraid to go into the bathroom again! Sheeeesh, this room was definitely not ready for motel guests. Hopefully, the Saga will return to its glory days, but until that time, it would be wise to choose from one of Flagstaff's other fine motels. As they say, "Things Change!" Bon Voyage!!!
reviews.title: An Interesting Saga !!!

reviews.text: I stayed here after arriving on a very busy weekend. They were the last in town around midnight with a room left. I paid nearly $100 for a room for two people. The room itself was actually clean enough, having been on the road all day and it was late, I really didn't care about much else. I noticed the window had "Season's Greetings" painted on the window. This is June...don't want to rush to take Christmas stuff down. I wondered how much attention to detail there was in this place.
reviews.title: Pay a low price, get low quality

reviews.text: Overall, the stay was uneventful. The hot water was sparse for the shower. The thing that really struck me as odd was that the checkout was 11AM, but at 9:58AM my phone rang, and they clerk/owner(?) wanted to know if I would be staying a second night. I said no we'd be leaving. He informed me it was 10:30 and checkout was less than 30 mintues away. Umm, no, it's not even 10:00 according to my cell and CNN. This irritated me that they were calling to rush me out early, especially having checked in only 10 hours earlier and paying double what they would normally get. Unbelievable.
reviews.title: MOST HORRIBLE PLACE EVER

reviews.text: Me, my husband and our two children decided to move to flagstaff to be closer to my mother in law she rented us a room here at the saga for a little over a week until we could get our own place. At first the room was fine not the best ever but not the worst so I thought. Having a two year old she spilled chocolate milk on the bathroom floor being that you only get white towels in a hotel I wiped it up. The next morning I find ants all over the bathroom floor okay I say no problem I will call the front desk and ask for them to come clean up. I am then told that they do not come clean the rooms, they tell us to bring our dirty towels to them and they will give us clean ones. My husband brings them the dirty towels and the lady YELLS at him for the towel having the chocolate milk on it. He then informs them of the ants and they say I will spray. They come into our room and spray raid on the bathroom floor mind you I have a 2 yr old and a 7mo old who crawls on the floor. Then they give my husband a broom to sweep the room out himself to rid the room of any other ants, And then they YELL at us again for not bringing the broom back to them. We then decide since they do not clean that we will put out our do not disturb sign. They still enter our room several times unannounced. We would come back from being out on the town and find things in our room missing such as our alarm clock (yes it is theirs but they just came and took it from our room). We have come back several other times to find the room has been entered with the DND on the outside of the door. and they did not do anything in our room other then dumb the garbage and put grocery bags from food that we bought back in the trash can and pick our dirty towels up off the floor and hang them back up. One day we are outside with our children playing on there so called playground and they ask my husband to do some work in the parking lot for them telling him that they would pay him. He did the work but never received any pay for it. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND STAYING HERE TO ANYONE!!!!! Oh yeah the WIFI SUCKS YOU CAN BARLEY GET IT TO CONNECT.
reviews.title: I think I can feel death creeping up on me as I write this...

reviews.text: It's SOOOOOO gross. Like something in a horror movie. I'm about to walk out to my car to get my own blankets because this bed is so gross I don't even want to imagine how many people are brought here to be murdered. DO NOT STAY HERE. My wife and I are gonna go get tested for HIV because of this bed.
reviews.title: The Horror of the Night!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: do not ever stay here!!! staff are thieves!
